Reviews.Content: I always stay with Starwood hotels of which W is part of. This was my first time in Westwood part of Los Angeles. The hotel is on a quiet street 2 blocks from Westwood village. Great hotel, professional friendly staff. Rooms have typical W cool vibe.

Reviews.Title: “Another "WOW" from W”
Reviews.Author: RogerVegas
Reviews.Content: From the moment you arrive in valet the service never stops. For those of you who have never stayed at a W, it is all about service, as they say, "Whenever/Whatever." We stayed over Easter (4-9 to 4-13) and check in was a breeze. We had 2 rooms and both were a suite. We were able to check in early, given pool views and rooms on the same floor. The suite we each had was a 1 bedroom with a nice size living room that had a wet bar, couch (seating for 4 easily), flat screen TV, DVD player, stereo, desk. The bed room had a queen size bed tightly squeezed into the bedroom with a flat screen on the wall. The TV location made it hard to walk around the bed, but was something I could deal with. The bathroom was a nice size with rain forest shower head that had plenty of power and plenty of hot water. Bath amenities are the standard Bliss lemon/sage. Also the bedroom closet was more than antiquate and had a safe that I could easily fit my lap top, camera and other valuables in. The room was clean and well lite. The windows open for some fresh California (hmm..well sort of fresh) air. I ordered room service each morning and to my surprise each suite has a loud doorbell. With the W's normal standard of service, the room service waiter asked to enter the room and set up everything very nicely. I only ordered a large pot of coffee ($20) and the assortment of 3 pastries ($15), Coffee was fresh as were the pastries. The pool area is a decent size for the hotel, the pool itself small. Plenty of cabanas and lounge chairs. Enjoyed it. Ate at the Backyard and Saturday brunch was $39 and very good. Great salad!! I would recommend for a nice outdoor meal. Great seating area with couches and comfy chairs! Whiskey Blue had a crowd on Saturday night and we had to show our room key to get into the hotel and once again for the elevator. Was crowded and did not visit that night. We did have drinks the first night, $12-$14 a drink, standard LA prices. Valet is very attentive and always willing to give great directions for those traveling without a GPS. Valet is $32 per night with unlimited in/out. Arriving late on evening I found that my room key was not working. You do need a key to get up in the elevator to your room, but my friend's key worked for that. My fault for carrying my key next to my cell phone, but the front desk was helpful -- and keeping a hooker in her place. She was demanding to contact a room (didn't have room number but only a name and it wasn't a full name..hmmmm) and the front desk simply told her she could use the courtesy phone and the operator would connect her to the room if she had the full name .. The lovely hooker in her fashionable cut off shorts and extremal high heels used some colorful language that allowed security to remove her. I like the idea that they do take care of their guest's security and volume levels. It allows a relaxing time. The rooms are quite and the do tell you in the in room guide that no parties are allowed in the suites and violators will be evicted. So if you are coming here to have a big party -- better think twice! I liked this as it allows you to sleep in peace!!! This hotel has excellent customer service at all points of contact. People are friendly and seem to enjoy their job! I would recommend this hotel to everyone who is planning on visiting Beverly Hills, West Hollywood, UCLA, Hollywood and Santa Monica..close to all. For those without a car, they do offer transportation within 10 miles by booking the house car at no cost. Just a tip for the driver would be good.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: business-class08
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for a night a while back with some friends. Great bar and very well designed hotel. We had some confusion with the room service order and ended up with more than we asked for. One of the managers Michael Dunbar contacted me after we left and made sure everything was fixed. Very good customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Overhyped”
Reviews.Author: Glitterpuss
Reviews.Content: I had a two night stay booked here as part of a competition win. On arrival we were "upgraded" to a spectacular suite. The suite comprised of an adequately sized bathroom with 6 travel sized Bliss products (which were great!) There was a stylish bedroom with flat screen TV, and queen sized bed, which looked out onto a flat roof of the hotel annex. The third part of the suite was a lounge/bar area with another large flat screen TV, and also DVD player and iPod dock. As with most hotels there was a mini bar, and snacks to buy. These were extortionately priced, and if you did purchase a bottle of water at $8 you then had to pay a 20% restocking fee also. There was supposed to be free Wi-Fi in the lounge area, however it was a little intermittant and some days would not allow outgoing emails to be sent. If you wanted Wi-Fi in your room you also had to pay. Breakfast was not included, but I believe there was complementary coffee in the lounge each morning which we didnâ€™t try. We preferred to Breakfast at Peetâ€™s coffee shop just round the corner, which had a more reliable and free Wi-Fi. The location of the hotel is OK, It's close to some restaurants and cinemas in the village, but we didn't find it convenient for exploring LA itself unless you had a car. If you're looking for somewhere trendy, and you're one of the beautiful people (or would like to be) this is the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Tragically hip. Trying hard but leaves room to be desired”
Reviews.Author: dwhir
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located a quick walk's away from the bustling downtown area in Westwood, so the location is good. The staff is very friendly and work hard to make your experience pleasurable. However, the hotel is trying so hard to be "hip" that it doesn't always seem to cater to the needs of "average" people. For example, my bathroom was tiny. The rest of the room was fine, except the bathroom was so small that there was no place to place my dopp kit. Also, the gym is very underwhelming for a hotel in this price range. The food options are limited, but that's expected for a "W" property. All in all, it's a fine place to stay, especially given the limited choices in Westwood. Just don't expect too much.

Reviews.Title: “Hip of the Hip of the Hip”
Reviews.Author: MatMo
Reviews.Content: In short, if you want to feel everything that young "Hollywood" should be, this is a great place for you. Rooms are all very large with sitting area for entertaining, desk, fridge, nice bathroom, and great bed as always at the W. Staff is very kind and attentive, they definitely have a little "Hollywood" edge to them, but are very helpful & kind. However, be prepared to spend money...lot's of money if hanging out at the hotel and pool. It's hard not to spend $20 just walking around the place. Spend a couple hours at the pool and you'll be down a hundred or so bucks in a heartbeat. I went there expecting everything to be expensive, but I blew through money so quick it was scary. In addition, this may sound odd, but as nice as the room and atmosphere was...it really got on my nerves after a full day of hanging out. The best way I could describe it is that it's a place for every Hollywood "Wannabe" and the occasional actual movie or TV star to visit. You go out to the pool, and every local wannabe movie star, singer, or otherwise comes there to be seen, and I mean "be seen". The sights are incredible and WELL worth the time at the pool (do not bring someone under the age of 17 to the pool). However, the fakeness is so thick it'll gag you...it's like being at a live Broadway show, but you're in real life. The girls and guys are top notch, but they also feel like they ALL have to act the part - all the time, which get's annoying. They even set-up a fake security force (it's real security, but not at ALL needed) with velvet ropes outside of the hotel at night with guys having the ear-piece radios and everything to keep the "lesser cool" crowd out of the hotel lounges/clubs. It's kind of funny to watch because it makes you feel like you're going to the most exclusive hang-out in the world, but it's really not - it's just a show so they feel like they're one of those super exclusive Hollywood clubs...again, all the "Wannabe's" come rolling back in for the night shift. I know this review sounds crazy, but it's one of those things you have to "see to believe". It's a great place to stay and experience a great atmosphere - but if you go there to hang out all day/night, it will drive you crazy and cost tons of money unless you have 6-pack abs, and a face of gold, a million dollar wardrobe, and another million sitting in the bank. Otherwise, just visit this place for a day or two max and you'll have a great time.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT hotel- location, amenities, staff- everything!”
Reviews.Author: Eyeluvpets
Reviews.Content: My husband and I did a 8 night stay in Southern California (started off at another "Starwood" brand hotel in San Diego- the 'US Grant'- also a top pick of mine) The W Westwood is awesome! Very sheek hotel, great location between Beverly Hills and Bel Air...also right across from UCLA so there are tons of restaurants, bar, and shopping in walking distance 2 blocks up from the hotel. Great location if you planned on going to Universal, Warner Brothers, Redeo Drive, The Getty, Kodak Theater, Santa Monica Pier, etcâ€¦just a great central location. The W upgraded us to a 800 sq ft suite and it was BEAUTIFUL! It has everything you need- plus more- like a DVD player, I-pod station, top of the line 'Bliss' amenities (I checked- a set of travel sized goes for $25 each at Sephora!) The pool is beyond amazing...the only down side is the fancy cabaÃ±as you need to rent out for $200 a day (I was told people have private parties in them- they have flat screen tv's couches, etc in them. The rest of the pool area and outdoor dining was just so beautiful. Parking is $31 a day with in and out privilege....but there IS local street parking- you just need to be careful about the times and the meter hours! I would defiantly classify myself as a high maintenance snob....and this hotel was fine by me! Hope this helped!

Reviews.Title: “A disappointing W”
Reviews.Author: Julian5763
Reviews.Content: They tried to make some W hotels with an old building. Actually, you get old noisy AC, despite the fact you get suites, bedrooms are small. The swimming pool is tiny and there is no shower around!!! It takes a while to get your order at the restaurant for your breakfast and to summarize; you feel that the management is poor in this location.

Reviews.Title: “worst W i've ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: dj_bradleyb
Reviews.Content: My wife and i are big fans of W hotels. we've stayed in about 6 different ones. My wife was 9 months pregnant so i decided to treat her to a last weekend in a suite at the W in los angeles (needed to stay in la in case she went into labor). We got the "spectaular" suite and were so disappointed. the suite is divided into two rooms, making them both pretty small instead of one big suite. It was also very dark. Lastly, the artwork and accesories around the room seemed cheap (many cb2 vases and such). Definitley not up to W quality. It turns out that this W is actually a conversion of an old hotel which is probably a big reason for this W's problems. The service was very good, but the restaurants were very average and VERY expensive. we ate there the first night and spent $140 despite only having one drink. we were pissed as there are lots of restaurants in la we would have love to go to for less than that. It seemed like everything there was more expensive than other W's but maybe i'm wrong. The spa is great and was the highlight for us. expensive, but a great experience. The pool wasn't that great which was a big bummer for my wife. the lounges weren't comfortable and the cabanas were a joke. Lastly, for those of you who don't know westwood, it is pretty lame. not too many good restaurants. This location would not be good if you want to walk to good restaurants, bars, shopping. the bars in the hotel are ok, but the crowd is not. Not hip, just cheesy. If you are visiting LA, do not stay here. lots of other better, cheaper, better located hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Won't be back”
Reviews.Author: NapaDebbala
Reviews.Content: Just wanted to let you know about our stay. We usually stay at the Renaissance in West Hollywood. Comparing The W to the Renaissance, I would give the W a C- and the Renaissance an A+. This was our very first time using Starwood pointsâ€¦we have been loyal Marriott Rewards people for many years . â€¢ When we arrived at the W the bellman encouraged me to go check in and leave my bags there for him. I was concerned that the luggage and the loose bag and sweatshirts would get separated with several guys doing the work. Sure enough, as I was checking in I saw the cart come in and the loose items werenâ€™t with my luggage. He said â€œOh, I was wondering who they belonged to?â€� â€¢ We checked in on points. The reservationist gave us a room directly across from the elevators which we heard loud and clear from our room. To Compareâ€¦on our points at the Renaissance or any Marriott, they usually upgrade us and always make sure that we have a fabulous location and room. â€¢ The Bellman was not busy, but I was told to go ahead to the room and wait for my bags. Wait is just what I did. Feeling that there was absolutely no reason to wait since it wasnâ€™t busy at all downstairs, I called the front desk to request that the bags be brought up soon. At the Renaissance, the bellman waits while you check in and then follows you in the same elevator to your room with your bags. No waiting necessary! â€¢ The rooms were very inadequate for travelerâ€™s needs. Itâ€™s as if the hotel never did an analysis of basics that travelerâ€™s need. There was no place around the sink to put anything except a toothbrush and the toothpaste. There was no makeup table and mirror. The closets were tiny and there were no dresser drawers big enough to lay more clothes in them, except for the small ones in the closet. At the Renaissance, in fact, at every Marriott, there is always a makeup area with a mirror. There are always large dresser drawers. The sink area has plenty of room to lay out your toiletries. â€¢ I called for the concierge and the operator put me on hold (with my permission), but then she came back on the line sounding very flustered and asked if she could take a message for the concierge. Surprise, the Concierge never called me back. At the Renaissance the operators never get flustered, in fact, they always say â€œDelightedâ€�. â€¢ When we went down to the pool late Sat. afternoon it was crowded and there wasnâ€™t a seat to be had. We let the guy there know of our predicament. I think he had several optionsâ€¦First, he could have let us use one of the cabanas that were free since it was so late in the afternoon and there were no signs of it being occupied. Second, he could have watched us go to the bar and come and got us when some chairs became free. There was no follow up. â€¢ Needless to say, we wonâ€™t be back.

Reviews.Title: “YES”
Reviews.Author: joshua333
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel. It was very hip and cool and made me really feel like I was in LA, in a good way.

Reviews.Title: “fun”
Reviews.Author: marcel dam
Reviews.Content: the W westwood is a great place, wonderfull rooms with nice view. good service and with a special swing. we enjoyed it. The location is great!. The bar staff are a bit less on a friday or saturday evening when the seem to be catering a a specila (plastic and shallow) Lala-land crowd and forget about the hotel guests. Only after ordering 3 drinks they seem to except you and become friendly and start to give the service one may expect. Still a place to return to, nicely modern with a fresh style. the area alos offers nice bars, restaurants and shops.

Reviews.Title: “disgusting food”
Reviews.Author: nicole55
Reviews.Content: We went to the restaurant, "nine thirty" which was empty, (should've seen the signs) on a Tuesday night. The mixed green salad was made with old lettuce leaves, and tiny, so we sent it back. The snapper wasn't even cooked through (it was not meant to be seared) and was very tough so we had to send it back for them to actually cook it. It came back 20 minutes later, spongey and tasteless. So our dinner ended up being greasy brussell sprouts and broccoli. Our waiter left half way through dinner, then a new one came to introduce himself, then the old one came back! they didn't offer to comp our over-priced meal ($34.00 for the snapper that we did not eat!!) and we tried to complain on the way out, but the hostess was nowhere to be found. To top things off, I waited forever for my car at valet. It was the most horrible dining experience I have had in Los Angeles.

Reviews.Title: “horrible restaurant service and management”
Reviews.Author: cenkLosAngeles
Reviews.Content: I celebrated my birthday in the hotel's restaurant. i called them to confirm if there is any charge for serving the cake i bring in. They said I shouldn't worry, the cutting is complimentary. At the end of the nigth they charged me $5/person for the cake. When I mentioned this to the manager he had an attitude and i ended up paying $50 extra. Also, there are 2 restaurants in the hotel, which I didn't know in the beginning. 1st i made a reservation for 6 people, and when i called them to increase the reservation to 10 people and the girl on the phone took my credit card # because it is necessary for reservation over 8 people. I know that it is normal. But when I went to the restaurant, there was a reservation for 6 people, and they didn't know who took my card #. Also they checked the other restaurant too, but there was no reservation over there, too. What a serious management. We spent $700 in the restaurant and it was a horrible and slow service. I guess too many people are trying to get in the restaurant, that's why they don't care to please you. They just want to take your money. I am not going back there again.

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: Rudsker
Reviews.Content: Used to stay here since it was the only hotel in Westwood. They let you know they were the only choice. Not so great service. Employees have an attitude.

Reviews.Title: “Professional, not snotty”
Reviews.Author: Peewee68
Reviews.Content: I had been here already a few times a few years ago before the renovation of the rooms and things are going better. Room was big, hip and comfortable. Staff is professional, although things went a bit wrong at check in and check out, and although trying to act cool, not snotty whatsoever. The Thirtynine restaurant is nice, the pool area a bit small. Location is ideal if you want to be central in LA, although nothing is going on in this neighbourhood. Prices are reasonable if you look at the quality. In general: a good choice for travellers that feel young.

Reviews.Title: “W is GREAT”
Reviews.Author: FattyMcFatterson
Reviews.Content: Let me start off by saying that things were malfunctioning in our room, i.e. cable, a/c, etc. but because of their very gracious and wonderful staff I will go back again!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! They couldn't fix the problems, but the did more than make up for all the issues. About the room: I stayed in a corner room suite. It was really roomie and nice. The temperature of the room was preset. There was mood music playing as well. The bed was super comfie! The bathroom left little to be desired but everything else was awesome! I didn't get to partake at Bliss Spa, but I did stop in and buy some product! The location of hotel is in the heart of westwood. The area was in a nice residential area, and you didn't get any of that UCLA party stuff. Overall, its your typical W starwood hotel experience. Hip, awesome, blah blah blah.. PS. Did I mention that the staff was awesome?????? Cause they were.

Reviews.Title: “Hip Hotel with lots of funk”
Reviews.Author: susanj1310
Reviews.Content: This hotel is definately hip and not for someone who wants quiet. The rooms have been updated so the decor is a funky 70's style to it (not exactly our taste) but you can't fault it. The hotel itself has a very laid back atmosphere. The staff were all very helpful, professional and anything you want they will try to accommodate it. The backyward bar is totally hip - it is right next to the pool area which has open sunbeds that are about the size of a queen bed! The location is close to Bevery Hills and Rodeo drive and has very easy access to the 405 so you can get anywhere you need to go. A tip - remember LA traffic is a nightmare to plan an extra 20 minutes to whereever you want to do to! All in all we can't fault this hotel at all!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful choice for LA”
Reviews.Author: LReego
Reviews.Content: We are discriminating travelers and so always worry when we try a new hotel. We were on our way to the desert with our children (ages 12 and 17) and wanted to stop in LA for a night. Anyway, we arrived at 7:00p and were promptly greeted by the parkers. Upon checking in, we asked to have both rooms nearby which was not available. So Angel, at the front desk, was so kind to upgrade us, as SPG clients, to a full 2-bedroom suite. That evening, we dined at the hotel's restaurant, 930, and had Jeffrey, a wonderful waiter. While the food and wine was pricey, all five of us enjoyed our meal and the incredible service. The room was contemporary but comfortable with nice flat screen tv's in every room (even the bathroom) and Bliss products. We only had a few complaints: the bottled water was $9 . . . how silly; the parking was $31 . . . why not include it; even though the bathroom is large, it is not well-designed as there is no area for make-up, hair brush, etc. and the make-up mirror is right next to the shower door. Finally, the air conditioner knocked in the morning which needs to be addressed. The bellman are extremely kind and they got the bill exactly right. We'd stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Yuck”
Reviews.Author: KLR_ParkCity
Reviews.Content: I'll start by saying I was here for business, not pleasure. My business associate had booked us to stay here. Very pretentious and the entire wing we were staying in smelled of marijuana. It fired up in the evenings. I told the front desk, but they did nothing to hunt down the culprits. This place definitely caters to the tragically hip. Not my cup of tea.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful W”
Reviews.Author: elise m
Reviews.Content: I loved my five night stay at the W. I was on a mixture of business and just fun, and it couldn't have been a better fit. L.A. can be hard to get around, but the W is in a great location in Westwood Village, and a pleasant walk to great restaurants, movies, theater, and other services. The hopping bar/restaurant at night was fun and hip-but-not-[--], the spectacular pool/lounge/outdoor dining patio was a delight, (and in late February, the scent of blooming jasmine and cherry blossoms was the just what this winter-weary northerner needed). And to top it off- the BLISS spa on the second floor, well-- it was Bliss-ful. And the bath amenities in the rooms are theirs. There is a gym- but , not being so into the iron-pumping, I put on my sneakers, walked out the door and jogged through the amazing UCLA botanic gardens. Room service was prompt, the staff is beyond friendly, the concierge suggested and obtained great reservations. My spectacular suite was suitably spectacular, spacious, and full of high tech goodies- there was even an ipod dock, which solved my problem of having forgotten my charger. Would I stay here again? In a L.A. Minute! My only complaint? $31/day for parking and $15/day for internet.

Reviews.Title: “Worth every cent!”
Reviews.Author: Love2GoSee
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had to be at UCLA for his cancer treatment and wanted to be very close to the campus. We looked at several places online but decided on the W. The hotel is very modern, which is not my taste - however everything is done extremely well. The service is excellent and when I checked in Tracy Morgan of 30 Rock was in line in front of me. The W is just a few blocks from the UCLA campus and within walking distance of the Westwood Theater and Shopping district. We are part of the Starwood network and because of this we were upgraded to a suite on the 6th floor. The short version: Not the cheapest hotel in the area but worth every cent if you want to be treated like a celebrity.

Reviews.Title: “Impressed - even considering the price”
Reviews.Author: MiamiAce
Reviews.Content: I am primarily a business traveler. When my colleague wanted to stay at The W, I was afraid it might be too chic for my taste. I was wrong. Each room is a mini-suite, and very comfortable, and I had a wide screen plasma in the living room. The staff was what you normally expect from a 5-star hotel. The bed and linens were exquisite - I really didn't want to get up to catch my flight. The shower was full-force, and adjusted to temperature immediately. How do they do that? It made me forget all those mornings backing up the tub with the shower, waiting for the water to warm up. Quibbles: 1) my window faced a concrete wall. You would think a luxury hotel would have contemplated the arrangement of rooms architecturally;and, 2) I had to pay $14.95 for high speed internet access. You would think for $400/night, the hotel could throw in the internet hook-up. All in all, worth the extra money.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Experience”
Reviews.Author: tokyogal
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one week and I had a wonderful experience. As a gold star member, I was upgraded and my room was huge. They have recently renovated the place, and it is tasteful and trendy. The service was friendly, the rooms were very clean. The only reason that I didn't give it a 5 is because the walls are somewhat thin..especially when you have a group of NOISY women staying next door. Security was prompt when getting them to turn down their music but nothing could be done about the thin wall and noisy ladies. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who can afford it.

Reviews.Title: “Building Great! Staff AWFUL!”
Reviews.Author: eventqueenatlanta
Reviews.Content: we've stayed here probably 40 nights just this year and so we have a variety of experience here. basically, i LOVE the location. very convient and the hotel design is lovely, as is the pool area. the rooms are fantastic! the service however is HORRIBLE. they NEVER get your reservations right and we are platinum SPG members. they also kind of don't do anything but stand around wearing black clothes. if design made a four star hotel, then this would be one, but service is important too. they NEVER make the rooms on time and you have to beg them to come. if you call for a bellhop be prepared to wait at least an hour as we did last time. We also had issues of smoke coming through the floors from smoking rooms into our rooms in THREE different rooms. really an issue. and if you are facing the back of the building be prepared to hear all night Frat parties from UCLA. if they had a topnotch staff if would be awesome, but they don't.

Reviews.Title: “Surprised with a fantastic stay”
Reviews.Author: Paolo01
Reviews.Content: This hotel was recommended to me by a friend of mine who knows all things chic. I was very pleasantly surprised that the hotel was actually a fantastic stay. From the outside the hotel is really not much. However, once you have crossed the threshold you enter what I have now come to know as the W scene. The only thing preventing this hotel from getting an excellent rating was the uber cool reception received at the check in desk. They were simply trying too hard to not be impressed by anything or anybody. The hotel though was very nice. We enjoyed excellent room service both for diner and breakfast on two occasions. The pool scene was very pleasant. There were many people "visiting" the pool to be seen. We had a great time just enjoying drinks by the pool. The bathroom of my 1 room suite W room was nice, though it included one of those molded tub/showers vice a walk in shower which you see at some newer rooms. But it was very pleasant. Our room was booked with the "Bliss" code which included a spa type welcome package of products that could be used in your room. It was nice, though I am not sure worthy of declaring an entire promotion based off of it. Will look for other W properties based off of this stay. This hotel was memorable. I now use the term "W" like when looking at other modern/urban/gray decors

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous Hotel”
Reviews.Author: StephaniB
Reviews.Content: Gorgeous Hotel. Spacious 1 Bedroom Suite All to myself!!!!! Was traveling for Business during Grammy Week. So many people were in town. Definately a great time to Be in LA. Will definately go back. Rooms are very clean, and house keeping is very attentive. Food is a bit pricey, but decent. Shopping is nearby. Concierge was very helpful in providing me with a map to Rodeo Drive. Had a great time. Will definately go back and bring my husband with me this time!

Reviews.Title: “Hip, Comfortable and Stylish”
Reviews.Author: Edmond_ET
Reviews.Content: Never judge based on first impression.... My first impression of the W Westwood â€œOH MY GOD IS THAT WHERE WE ARE STAYING AT THE BUILDING LOOKS CRAPPYâ€�. However, after the warm greetings from the valet parking stuff to the timely check in process and the hip dÃ©cor of the lobby (with some refreshment and fruit infused water in the lobby), I am like â€“ thatâ€™s what a hotel is supposed to be like. PRICE: I paid $279 for one night and the other night I used my 12,000 SPG points. ****Suggestion****** If you use points only, you might not get an upgrade. Since I paid for a night and I asked the booking agent to put a note on my file to request an upgrade, I was being upgraded to a suite, which was very comfortable and spacious. However, the best deal is to use points and cash, which is $89 a night and 4,000 points. So for 2 nights you will end up using 8,000 points and only $180 but you need to book ahead to avoid blackout dates. PARKING: Some attacked the $31 valet parking fee but I found it being rather fair, considering we have in and out privilege, and we stayed for 2 nights 3 days there but W only charge $62 for about 20 times in and out. POOL area is VERY nice and hip with great music; fruit juice/apples for free. BREAKFAST: Smoked salmon bagel for $13 very good portion of smoked salmon; Lobster Omlette $20 had good serving of lobster meat and mascarpone cheese in the middle, yummy! BAR: Very happening at night, HIP, good gimlet, had a great cucumber martini there, $12 each which every nice corner bar in LA charge at least $10 anyways so at the W it isnâ€™t that bad. SHOWER: The shower head is amazing with the best water pressure ever! BLISS shower gel and face wash is very refreshing. BED: My best sleep for the longest time. Heavenly! My only complain is that restaurant choices in the neighborhood is lacking. Try a local Japanese Grill restaurant called Nanbankan on 11330 Santa Monica Bld about 2 miles from the W it is gooood. Westwood is not a very hip and happening neighborhood but the good thing is after a night out you can still look forward to a really happening/nice party at the hotel you are staying at, what else can you expect?

Reviews.Title: “Fancy, Great Service, yet Overpriced.....”
Reviews.Author: spideymph
Reviews.Content: My stay at the W was a for one night using points. It was a standard room in the 9th floor. I have to agree with the other reviewers that the urban flare does not translate to comfort, and the room and everything else was overpriced. The parking was $31 a night for guests, which is similar to other hotels downtown LA (I was paid $35 at the Westin Bonaventure a few days ago). The service is exeptional and you get really people cattering to your needs. The room had a great view of Westwood, but the Plasma was in an ackward position on the room, as you needed to turn your head to your right in order to watch the screen as it was mounted on the right wall not in front of the TV. The towels were average quality, and the decor was really nice. The bar was happening at night and had a great time. Since I paid with points I dont know how much it would had cost to stay at this W, but I am assuming it would had been over $189 a night. I used 12,000 SPG points for this night and I dont think it was worth it. Over the last few weeks I had stayed at the 4 Points Culver City about 5 miles from the W, and had used 4,000 SPG points and paid $10 for parking for a newly remodeled room. Overall, I enjoyed my stay at the W, yet I feeel that for those paying rack rate, you are better off at a newer and less fancy hotel.

Reviews.Title: “ok, style over substance”
Reviews.Author: Pard61
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for business trip, nice room , though the whole hotel has a feeling of style over substance, for example while the desk in my room looked great it was very difficult to work at, ended up using the rooms coffee table. Also, the hotels business center seems to be a poor after thought, the person working it gave very good directions to a local art galleries, but was unsure of how to send a fax (had to ask someone at the front desk- who was also unsure and had to ask anther person at the front desk-fax then got sent).

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful W”
Reviews.Author: J2meLumi
Reviews.Content: Located in an assuming neighborhood, the W provides chic elegance to Westwood. You walk in and are welcomed by doorman and asked if there is anything that they can assist you with. This sets the precedence for the rest of your stay. The rooms are clean and modern, but doesn't lack comfort. The beds are the Starwood staple of the "wonderful" bed which are in fact, wonderful. The suites have two flatscreens (one in the living room, one in the bedroom) as well as a CD player with their W CD provided for your listening enjoyment. The bathrooms are extremely clean ( I notice every fleck of dirt) and the robes are very soft. I placed the breakfast card out at 1am for fresh coffee and a bagel to be delivered at 8:15. At 8:15 a smiling waiter arrived at my door and was very accomodating. This is a hotel that likes to please their guests. We had drinks at the Backyard by the pool upon arrival and were served STRONG Mai Tais and a Lady drink of some sort all with a smile. We also had drinks at Whiskey Blue after dinner and were greated again with accomodation. The bouncer went out of his way to find us a nice table so we can watch all the people go by. The W doesn't disappoint with the man candy! All these male waiters/bartenders who are very easy on the eyes...my husband said there was eye candy for him too. :) All-in-all, the W westwood does not disappoint.

Reviews.Title: “W Hotel doesnt recognise loyal guests!”
Reviews.Author: Samuel-D
Reviews.Content: I am one of Starwood's most loyal guests, I have stayed in Starwood properties with work 57 nights in the past 9 months on 27 different stays, also stayed in W Sydney and W Chicago and I wanted to treat myself by rewarding points while travelling to LA. First, when booking they told me they didnt have any standard room so I had to pay extra points to book a higher category, when arriving at the W hotel, the tall blond guy (its a W hotel, its standard) was rude and didnt acknowledge my requests, as a Platinium member I didnt have any upgrade, rather, I had one of the worst views, facind the inner courtyard. The hotel is currently being refurnished, so everywhere you go you see construction workers and when using the elevators; you take the "staff" one as the toehr ones are not always working. The rooms are quite big, but the one I had didnt have exterior lights so you almost had to turn on the lights 24/7. When doing the check out; the overcharged me for over 100 dollars, which they took off, but i realised afterward on my credit card statement that they still charged me for some extras ( in the mini bar i believe) that i didnt use. The property is nice; but the swimming pool is very small, the valet are rude (31 dollar per day). However the location is great, its in the middle of Westwood, close to Beverly Hills, Santa Monica and Westwood itself is nice, its where UCLA is and as a result its lively and full of nice restaurants and cafes. The Concierge was very nice, she recommended some nice restaurants. I hope this helps

Reviews.Title: “Urban and Inviting”
Reviews.Author: travelbugChicago
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one evening while laying over for our flight to Hong Kong for our Honeymoon. Our Wedding Reception was held at a W hotel and so it was a natural choice in terms of the places we would stay for our trip. We were way impressed with the level of service provided by the staff. We were immediately upgraded to the Mega Suite (ordered a regular room), and while I know this is not the norm, were impressed with their willingness to accomodate a young couple who paid for the room by Starpoints! Great location too. Can walk to restaurants or take a cab (whatever your preference) Poolside was nice too. Great service their as well. Read a review something to the effect of "what you would expect from a W" but I don't think that you always get that level of service at every W hotel unfortunately. Feel free to contact: We are young (27/29), honest, pay attention to detail, but realistic on what you should expect - so ask away.

Reviews.Title: “Nice property”
Reviews.Author: citychickie
Reviews.Content: My husband and I chose this location because it was the nicest hotel close to our friends that we were visiting. Because my husband travels for business we stayed using points so I cannot comment on the cost value. The property was relaxing and we enjoyed our drinks and dinner in the backyard. We wished it was warm enough that weekend to go for a swim and liked the fact that it was sectioned off for guests only to keep it from getting too crowded. If you drive you will be forced to use their valet service since all their signs say not to park in the neighborhood. I think it was $30 a night for hotel guests. That's pretty standard for W Hotels, I believe. I can only complain that the elevators took an awful long time. There also was a time I needed directions to a restaurant from Concierge only to not find anyone in the early evening. The Welcome Desk Agent told me to just wait instead of offering her time to help. We didn't wait and decided to eat at the Backyard which was better than going out. Yes, the rooms are standard W Hotel rooms. Simple slightly worn furniture. These rooms very roomy compared to their NY properties. We will definitely stay here again when we again visit our friends in Westwood.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: toflyer
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel, in a more quiet residential neighbourhood, but within walking distance of shops, restaurants, cafes. The hotel was under construction, renovating the rooms. Stayed in a newly renovated room, very nice rooms. Bathroom was on the small side, but very nice. The restaurant and bar downstairs were also great, good food, excellent service. I'd absolutely stay again, one of the nicer W's I've stayed in. The pool area is nice, quiet, good service there as well. You've probably seen the pool on TV, it's used in a number of shows. They were filming a show (1 day) while we were there.

Reviews.Title: “Modern and chic! This is the place for the young single with money!”
Reviews.Author: asianphilosopher
Reviews.Content: The W Los Angeles â€“ Westwood Time of stay: December 27, 2006 Purpose of stay: leisure/pleasure CHECK-IN: - Staff were pleasant, helpful, and prompt in assisting us. CONCIERGE: - Staff at curbside were attentive in opening our car doors and taking our luggage. Only complaint was that it took them over 30 minutes to deliver our baggage to our room. This may have been due to the fact only one elevator was working during our stay. ROOM CONDITION: - As expected, our room was decorated in a very modern, contemporary, and minimalist fashion. - When we entered the room, the television was on with a hip sound-track playing. The television was showing a hotel overview and also gave introductions to other W hotels in the world. - Our bathroom was beautifully done. Frosted glass counters gave the bathroom an elegant look. Elegant wall sconces on either side of the bathroom mirror was a nice touch. - Toiletries were excellent. *Bliss* spa products were provided (shampoo, conditioner and shower gel). Bottles were very tiny, however. Only really enough for 1-2 uses. - Our television was a bit dated (the CRT/boxy variety) - A comprehensive selection of fashion and tourist magazines were spread out on the coffee table in front of the television for our browsing. A nice touch. - The bed was quite comfortable. Sheets were clean and fresh. RESTAURANT - The Restaurant is on the left-side of the hotel when you walk into the main lobby. The ambience is decidedly modern, elegant, and classy. - Food quality was excellent. I had a martini with my dinner. Service was prompt and friendly. An excellent place to bring a date for an intimate, romantic, and memorable time. - Food prices were typical of high-end hotels. PRICE: - I used my Air Canada *Aeroplan* points to book the room. Otherwise, the price would have been over $300 USD per night. There is a parking fee charge but I canâ€™t remember the exact amount. Parking at downtown hotels in Los Angeles and San Francisco can run up to about $50 USD per night! OVERALL: - The hotel is located off the beaten track. Itâ€™s nestled between some high-end condominium high-rise buildings. - Everything about this hotel and other W Hotels is about being chic. The hallway lighting is dim with accent lighting in cool colours. The elevator has LCD televisions installed around its perimeter. When you walk in there is a hidden-camera that projects your image onto the wall. Itâ€™s a bit disconcerting at first, but definitely a cool effect. - This hotel is recommended for young singles or couples who want to be surrounded by other young cool people (with money). You just might bump into someone famous at the hotel bar/restaurant! - Arrive after dark! The ambience is amazing at night with the hotelâ€™s excellent atmosphere/ambient lighting. - As is usual for the W Hotels, it is a destination for the chic, moneyed, and celebrity-types.

Reviews.Title: “Great Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: RedEve
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the W Los Angeles Westwood May 29 - June 7, 2007. As a regular Four Seasons patron, I am used to service. The W does not disappoint and even outdid The Seasons. Nothing was too much trouble. We stayed at the W to be close to UCLA as we flew from Florida for my mother to have brain surgery for tumors. The W is very close to the UCLA clinics and hospitals. As a young female, I felt very safe walking in the neighborhood, anywhere from 5am to 11pm. The front desk staff, especially Alfie, went out of their way to make check in easy and smooth. Upon arriving, I found the two rooms we had booked were across the hall. A little too far apart for me to hear if my mom had another seizure or complications after the surgery. Alfie immediately solved the problem. We were upgraded to a larger office suite with a bedroom and a pull out bed in the office. The W still charged only the UCLA Patient rate for the original room. The suite was spacious and clean. The only downside was the shower. The shower head is a little low, but no great difficulty even for a 5'10" person. The style department of the W even sent a fruit basket and a card telling us to ask for anything we needed after my mom's return from the procedure. Well, we took them up on the card. The third day after her procedure, my mom had a partial seizure while alone in the hotel room. She called the desk and the staff was immediately in the room to help her. She states they gently eased her to the ground from where she was slumped between the desk and the wall and had help there quickly. I was notified and at the hotel within 10 minutes to find the paramedics already present and treating her. The W even had a car ready for us to follow the ambulance to the ER. I called from the ER to ask if we could extend our stay as we were scheduled to leave the next morning. I was told not to worry, the room would be ours as long as needed. The next day, the staff, from Dione who helped my mom to the cleaning staff were asking how she was and if I needed anything. The entire staff really rose to this medical emergency. We had room service the first night. It was expensive as expected, but I was surprised at the amount of food and how good it was. Definitely a great deal for late night. We also ate at the hotel restaurant, Nine Thirty, the service, especially our waiter Paul, and the food was good. They also gave great suggestions for places to eat around the hotel. Palomino's became one of our favorites. The taxi from the airport to the hotel, with tip, was 40$. We didn't have a chance to use the pool or exercise, but it looked clean and well taken care of on a walk through.

Reviews.Title: “What you expect: good fro being hip and bad fro the same readon”
Reviews.Author: kareny13
Reviews.Content: The W hotels are all modeleld similialy: active bars, for the yuong/hip, stylish...and this one LA (read Hollywood) si no different. Friday and Saturday nights are scene, so you you are not part of the scene, avoid the street facing rooms on these nights. These rooms are wonderful - all suites, providing you with a separate living area. Tolieltries by Bliss, which is special. Complimentary cofee/tea facilities but do anything else and there goes you arm and leg! Fitness area small but functionable. Staff friendly and helpful. One f the worse hings of ths W is the elevators - every doubel I have stayed out in the US (over 12....you wait forever!!). I doubt get it!! This W is on a quite street near Holloywood and just bolcks away from Westwood Village.. but in the nieghoborhood area quite but is close to everything. And for a great dinner walk 1/2 block donw the street to Teng for some wonderful sushi rolls.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay at this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: yukachick
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for one night in early May. The hotel is okay, I think we paid near $400 for our room, which was a large suite. Coming from NYC, the size of the rooms are impressive. But I had the most horrible experience. I left my sunglasses and video ipod, priced around $700 in total, in the pocket of a robe. I had spent the afternoon by the pool and upon going back to my room, I placed the ipod and sunglasses (in a large pearl case) in the pocket of my robe. I hung up the robe on the bathroom door and took a shower. The following morning, when i checked out, I forgot to take the items from the robe. The next day, I realized I had forgotten my items in the robe in the bathroom. I called the hotel several times. The first time, I spoke with an agent named William who said he would conduct an investigation and give me a call right back. He did not call me back. So I called later in the evening and spoke to another agent who called me back within 10 minutes and said the items had not been found. Which was peculiar to me because I know for certain that i left them there. The next day, I called to talk to manager at the hotel. I spoke directly to the manager's assistant who assured me she would look further into the matter and get back to me as soon as possible. This was almost 3 weeks ago and I have heard nothing. It was a very bad experience for me because I think that hotels should be accountable and not take their customer's belongings that they overlook. I have never had an experience like this where i was not able to reclaim forgotten merchandise in a hotel room. Im dissappointed in the hotel and their staff for their lack of professionalism. I know that an ipod and sunglasses are not the end of the world, and thankfully it was not a much more important personal belonging. My advice is, avoid this hotel. It is overpriced and not worth the hassle. Also, the lack of concern by their managing staff is immensely disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “True Los Angeles Experience”
Reviews.Author: FrankandBruno
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay here for two nights, even though the reviews were less than sparkling. First of all, this is a wonderful hotel. If you prefer the stylings of a Holiday Inn...do not stay here. If you are looking for something different and luxurious, then stay here. While we were here there was a designer sample sale (which my wife loved) and a taping of the HBO show Entourage. That's what this hotel is, Hollywood mixed with high style. Our room was perfect. A super comfortable living area (couch, tv, desk, bar area) and an intimate separate bedroom. The hotel is located in a private,residential neighborhood away from the noise of the city. My ONE complaint is the elevators - they take forever! I found this to be something that is constant in California hotels... Anyway, I'm not sure where some of these other reviewers were staying, but we truly enjoyed the W.

Reviews.Title: “Swanky Digs in Westwood”
Reviews.Author: skinnedknee
Reviews.Content: Located on a small residential street in upscale Westwood, the W's exterior is low key....but that is certainly where the low key ends. The lobby is quite swank, and you can tell immediately who the hotel chain caters to....the affluent hipsters of the universe. We stayed in a mini-suite, which felt like a small 1 bedroom apartment with no kitchen. We had requested a non-smoking room and were unfortunate enough to receive a room that reeked of smoke (and had an ashtray in the armoire), so when you stay here, remember that lots of "hip" persons still smoke and will do so in non-smoking rooms. Amenities were upscale (Bliss toiletries, magnified make-up mirror, cd player clock radio) and the rooms were quiet, but if you're there on a weekend, be forewarned that the bar downstairs is PACKED, smells like incense and is nearly impossible to get service in.... it's very popular with patrons and locals alike. I LOVED the "beetle juice" hallways, and running into familiar faces (like Thom Filicia from Queer Eye). This is a great hotel for people who thrive on hip, stylish surroundings and hanging with similar people....a beautiful place for beautiful people. ,

Reviews.Title: “Must have got lucky...”
Reviews.Author: KateAp
Reviews.Content: I was fortunate enough to stay at the W in Westwood as the guest of an LA based friend and can only say that the negative reviews here surprise me. I was already in a great room so can't comment on upgrades or lack thereof, all I can say is that my room was spotless and was kept that way for the duration of my stay. One gripe: compared to the cost of eating elsewhere in LA, the hotel prices were extortionately expensive: $7 for a breakfast latte and $9 for granola even given US-size portions was outrageous And finally, maybe it's that the level of service in the US is so high elsewhere and maybe it's because I'm a Brit and we're generally so tolerant of rubbish service, but I thought the staff at the hotel couldn't have been more charming or helpful. Scott on the front desk and Brittan and the valet guys were utterly lovely - I shall be back!

Reviews.Title: “Trendy oasis in a busy city”
Reviews.Author: Feeber
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 2 nights in April. I checked in very late (midnight) as my plane was late arriving in LA. I was greeted by a very friendly valet who carried my bags in for me. Check in was efficient and friendly and I was upgraded due to my Gold status with SPG. Now that was nice! The room was great - a two room suite. The bedroom was a little small but fine. It was very clean. I had all meals there and the food is excellent. I even when back there for dinner after I had checked out before getting on the plane again. It was pretty trendy but not over the top. I really liked it and wished I could have stayed longer. I would 100% stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Good”
Reviews.Author: hwalter
Reviews.Content: Hotel is Ok. Rooms are clean. Front Desk is ok. For the price I would stay somewhere else next time. Location is in a residential district. You need a car to get to anywhere....

Reviews.Title: “Very Different”
Reviews.Author: LATravelDude
Reviews.Content: Unique experience - if your into modern cold surroundings, your like this hotel. Don't expect any added value for being a Platinum or Gold Level Starwood holder -- it just will not happen. No upgrades, no benefits, no club lounge, etc. Hotel rooms were clean. Shower is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great two nights”
Reviews.Author: wanttotravella
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the W Hotel in Los Angeles for 2 nights in January. Everything was great. I live in LA about 1/2 mile away from the hotel but my house was being fumigated. We had a large suite with two living rooms. My 2 kids shared the sofa bed (which was pretty uncomfortable). I am a Starwood member and upon entering the room, there was a welcome bottle of wine along with mixed nuts from the GM of the hotel. It was such a nice surprise and I suppose that they gave this to us because we are Starwood members. On the second night there was a lovely box of chocolates at our bedside. I think these small touches make you feel welcome and want to return. Our room was lovely and it had the biggest, most comfortable and fluffy bed ever. I want to get the same exact bed for my home. The lobby and bar had the cool W vibe. I've stayed at the W in San Diego, W in Times Square and now the W in LA. I have enjoyed all the W Hotels and will continue booking rooms there.

Reviews.Title: “Once again, beat up and tired”
Reviews.Author: traveltoomuchToronto
Reviews.Content: Hallways and room are best summed up as having the appearance of 30 years of Spring Break cavorting without a cleaning, stains on all walls, carpets, and furniture, typical dark W hallways and rooms, poor towels, overpriced water ($8 per bottle), staff with attitude at the front desk, car valets were very good, flies join you for your beakfast without invite, food stains all over the restaurant menus each time the last three stays, $3.25 surcharge for using the ATM and limited to $100 (what will $100 buy you at a W hotel?), well below expectation for a Starwood Hotel, do yourself a favour, bring Lysol or stay somewhere else. Instead of taking photos of guests in the elevators, they should video their cleaning staff to determine what they have been doing. The US disease control unit should be called into this overpriced dormitory. The Bliss Spa was excellent though.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional stay at the W Westwood”
Reviews.Author: EP7
Reviews.Content: As a Starwood member who stays in W hotels frequently due to business travel, I chose to reserve a room at a different hotel in Santa Monica while planning a trip to LA after reading all of the negative reviews on Tripadvisor (which I read religiously). However, was very disappointed with the other choice, checked out and was welcomed at the last minute on a weekend. With the exception of the slow elevators, which are a legitimate issue, everything about my stay was exceptional-- the cleanliness of the suite, the manager, staff, spa services, concierge and excellent dining. As an older woman business traveler, I never get the vibe that the W caters only to the young hip and beautiful--am always treated with warmth, respect and utmost courtesy. This was the first time tripadvisor advice steered me in the wrong direction. I imagine all the writers had legitimate issues and just bad stays which can happen--would strongly suggest giving the W in Westwood another opportunity in your travels.

Reviews.Title: “WOW! What a let down......”
Reviews.Author: celeste652
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival I felt let down as the car service had no drive to pull into we were rushed from curbside into our hotel.... Once up the stairs the doorman offered help with our bags... Too little! Too late! Plus every calorie burnt is one not on my hips...Okay, so stay with my ramble....At the desk I was greeted by a snotty girl about 5 years my junior and very grumpy.... We made our way to our room which was ready early as requested and down -free due to allergies. I complement them on this... but since there was no air and I had to change rooms three more times to find a room with working air their small triumph meant nothing to me in the end. Now in my newest room it took nearly two hours for hotel staff to get the down items out prior to bringing my allergy stricken mate into the room. I would like to say he slept peacefully in the old room without a working AC, but it was near the closet where they were working on the system and the workers were talking loudly on their phone outside our room... Did I mention we came in on a red-eye and were just trying to get a nap in prior to a social event that eveningâ€¦We just wanted to get some sleep alreadyâ€¦Then while awaiting the staff I sat on the sofa in my newest room staring out the window.... I noticed a bullet hole in the glass.... On the twelfth floor, but how?It had come from in the room... Scary, stuff... Guns generally do not go off where I reside..... I will stop this rant here where the room is finally ready, the air is finally working, and I open the drawer to the Ikea dresser only to have the face plate land on my foot ....What a let down... but if you ask for the UCLA rate...not discount you will save a little if you too are forced to stay hereâ€¦..

Reviews.Title: “So arrogant ! Hello, is me who is paying !”
Reviews.Author: Majito
Reviews.Content: Ok, I cant say the hotel is terrible, BUT, is a W and so expensive AND it looks a little old.... Nothing special, nor great. I stayed for a week when must of people stays for a couple of days, so, I was paying more than 3,000 and as I was paying with cash, they want me to leave them 2,000 more "just in case".... The staff was so arrogant as they were the ones who were paying the 3,000 and they were never useful.... Will stay there again only for the location. You can walk to UCLA.

Reviews.Title: “Never again.”
Reviews.Author: kakudmi
Reviews.Content: The room was ok, clean and comfortable and also $370 for the cheapest one. Looks like a 1 bedroom luxury apt, however, you touch anything in that room and there goes at least $30 from your card, even if it's just a bottle of water and even if you tell them not to charge you before they make a contact. So, one minus there. Second, I wanted to take a shower but couldn't because it took me too long to figure out where the f... is hot water knob, or level, or button, or whatever the hell they use to make the cold water become warm. Well, I'm 32 and I'm an IT professional. You'd figure, a guy like me can figure out the whole navigations system in BMW 6 series in less than 10 minutes, but here I'm trying to figure out how to turn on the hot water. So I gave up after almost a minute of freezing my but there. Second minus. Now I'm trying to reach them to figure out why did they charge me $50 for, and naturally, you won't get live person. You have to leave a message. Nice try. People usually give up when they have to leave a message for something like this. Well, not me. Certainly I'm not going there ever again. Have fun.

Reviews.Title: “Great 1st impression that doesn't follow through”
Reviews.Author: CatPacker
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the W for one night on a corporate account - thank goodness, because if I paid full price I would have been outraged. The hotel is dazzling at first glance - the glowing blue steps to the front door, beautiful lobby lounge spaces, friendly front-desk staff, free wireless internet in the lobby, etc. Which is exactly what I expected, having always heard great things about W hotels. It's the rooms (suites, really) that truly disappoint. After a slow elevator ride, you step off into a dimly lit hallway with uneven flooring under the carpet. The space itself is also dimly lit - even the bathrooms - so if you arrive after dark (as I did) it's hard to tell how dingy things really are. By the light of day I could see gouges in the furniture (maybe they should rethink their dog-friendly policy), many mystery stains in the bathroom floor, and more. In all, the bathroom was the worst part: the tub had a very slow drain, so I showered standing in dirty water, the light on the makeup mirror (which would have been a welcome touch) was broken. As a business traveler, I was also disappointed by the almost total lack of electrical outlets in my suite - except for one in the bathroom, they had been covered over with blank plates! It's not the end of the word to charge my laptop and phone in the bathroom, but it did seem weird. From my limited experience, there are better hotels, in similarly convenient places, at equivalent costs, in L.A. I will not choose to book at the W again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but I'd expected more”
Reviews.Author: EasyMeef
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in W Los Angeles in September because a friend of mine recommend that hotel. I mostly enjoyed the stay. The only downside was, that I forget to put some clothes in my bags when I checked out (ok, my fault). But as I called the reception at the same day, the tried to find it in our room, but wasn't able to find it anymore. That's not what I'm expecting from a hotel those claim is "W - Whenever, Whatever". :-)

Reviews.Title: “Great Location....Bad room”
Reviews.Author: Muntz73
Reviews.Content: No question this hotel is in an awesome location. The lobby is awesome and attracts quite the crowd. The positive traits stop as you have to wait for the very slow elevators. The rooms are the worst attempt of a remodel I've seen at a W. The room had nothing special except the heavenly bed. The bathrooms (which is something I always like to be plush) was horrible. Standard size tub/shower and it didn't even have the rounded shower curtain rod to give more space. The countertop and faucets were the same that were installed when this property was a Ramada Inn or equal. Room Service was very prompt and courteous. The Bliss Spa was very nice as well. This is a great place to see celebrities and enjoy the location. However, the room itself leave much to be desired.

Reviews.Title: “Caters to a certain breed -- not for everyone”
Reviews.Author: FemaleTraveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel is for a completely different breed of person to me. I am a solo business traveler with simpler needs -- a clean, comfortable room, quick courteous staff, easy access to decent meals either inside or just outside the hotel. Spa, cabana etc. are not in my travel dictionary. In that sense, it was the fault of my travel agent, and not the hotel that I felt so much of an outsider that I quickly cancelled the second night I was booked there. Found a hotel at half the price that met my needs. I prefer a hotel with friendly service than a cool lobby where the music is so loud that you can't hear what the person behind the desk is telling you.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: MikeGeee
Reviews.Content: After many trips to LA for biz & pleasure, I discovered the Westwood area and the W while staying here on business for the LA Film Festival. After staying at the W for the whole 10 days of the festival and three subsequent stays, I have to say it's a really great hotel. I travel 70% for biz and this is one of the best hotels I've stayed at in LA. I don't know where all the negative reviews come from. The valet, bell and doormen remember my name everytime I come. Check in is quick and a bellman is right with you when you go to your room. The first time I stayed there, the room I got had just been painted and didn't care for the smell. Called them up and they sent up a bellman with keys to a new room and moved my bags. They usually call the room about 30 minutes after check in to see if everything is to your liking. It is an older hotel, but all rooms are suites of various sizes, and twice was upgraded to a larger suite. The beds and pillows are EXTREMELY comfy and better than most hotels I've stayed at. The work area is very large and bathrooms are nice. The "Backyard" pool/lounge area is very nice. Nice green, lush area that seems to be miles away from LA (except for the occasional UCLA medical helicopter). Cabanas are open for the taking; food and drinks are very good and you may run into an occasional celebrity hanging out for a drink. The food at 9:30 restaurant is also very good. Whicky Blue is also cool to hang out for a couple of drinks. Valet parking is kind of pricey tho. The location is great! It's in a quiet residential area, but is only a couple of blocks from Westwood Village's many restaraunts, theatres & shops as well as a Longs, Ralphs, Best Buy and of course UCLA. It's an easy 20-30 minutes down Wilshire to Santa Monica (even in rush hour) and close to Sunset for those drives out to Hollywood. Be careful of jaywalking in Westwood Village, they will ticket you. Try the pineapple infused sake down the street at Tengu....

Reviews.Title: “VERY unimpressed”
Reviews.Author: Lindzini
Reviews.Content: I was very excited to stay at this hotel, but by the end of our stay I could not wait to leave and never stay there again, due to numerous service issues. The staff at this hotel, in literally every department is unable to successfully complete a task you ask of them without screwing something up. Everything was a challenge for them to get right. The pool attendants are never around when you need them, and take forever once you have placed your order and don't seem remotely concerned when you ask them 5 times for that drink menu you asked for 30 minutes ago, or they messed up your drink order. We thought that for a hotel of it's size the pool is completely inadequate and way too small for the number of guests. It was literally teeming with children everytime we tried to relax there. Our room was not very nice and had musty smell to it. It felt like no one paid attention to things like chipped paint on all the furniture or burnt out light bulbs in the room. I think a great hotel pays attention to those details. The majority of the hotel, excluding the lobby- which is very nice, had a run down feeling to it, and the hallways on all the floors where dark and musty, and personally I thought a little creepy. These are just my experiences, but I would not bother with this hotel and stay at one of the luxury boutique type hotels where they actually know how to do things right. Good luck.

Reviews.Title: “Find the Fake Plastic LA stereotype here.”
Reviews.Author: student2006
Reviews.Content: Comfortable rooms, with the best pillows I have ever slept on, and decent location but a hotel that generally lacks the attention to detail that mark out the best. A warning about the ambience of the hotel, especially at the weekends when it becomes packed with hipster wannabes. Useful if you want to experience the fake plastic LA stereotype, not so great if you want a peaceful nights sleep. Be prepared for visual dressings down by "trying too hard" 20 somethings in the nightclub like elevators. I didn't find the ambience to my liking so changed to the Omni in California Plaza. This hotel was just as comfortable, half the price, with a more professional clientel and business like ambience, if a characterless.

Reviews.Title: “The W is Way Cool”
Reviews.Author: K2K2
Reviews.Content: Had an awesome stay at the hip and happening W last weekend. The service was impeccable, the food was delectable and nothing beats hanging out at the pool with a cool cocktail. Love that they are hidden away from the maddening crowd, but still close to lots of hot spots. But recommend booking ahead at their spa Bliss - I couldn't get in all weekend.

Reviews.Title: “"Location" is it!”
Reviews.Author: Cal5gens
Reviews.Content: All the bad things you read in other reviews are true. There are 3 good things about this hotel - it's location, it's pet policy (allows them) and it's food/in room dining. Everything else is relying on the W's from other places to get it customers. There is no "housekeeping" - no robes, then after they delivered them, they took one away the next day and it never returned. Did not service at all one day and left us with no TP! No tissues ever re-appeared in the box. The featherbed was half way down the bed one night (lumpy!) and had to be re-made by me. Then the bed was short sheeted the next - I had to remake my bed every night! Didn't get fresh towels one day, or floor mat the next, or any bath mats at all the next. It has the noisiest toilets I've ever heard in any accomodations - they really shriek and you have to plug your ears in the all hardscape bath. It is an older building, so guest room and hallway noise are bad, although there is almost no street noise, there is much from the music at the "private parties" they hold at the pool. They also screwed up my bill, had the name sort of right (not the sex) but the address and the Starwood preffered number wrong - I corrected them but still don't have my points. If it wasn't for the location, it would've died by now because it's way to pricey for the lack of service.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Terrible Service”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the W hotel in Los Angeles and received terrible service. They lost my reservation and refused to accomodate any basic requests I made. I was treated with an aloof attitude, and the employees seemed to believe that they were the customers there and didnt seem to care about making the actual customers feel welcome and at home, nor were they providing a level of service you might expect at this hotel. They seemed to try to convey an image of cool, that came across as cold and aloof, coupled with a 'better than thou' attitude. A miserable experience.

Reviews.Title: “Oh to be young and hip”
Reviews.Author: softballsparky
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 nights at the W and really enjoyed our stay. Very swank hotel. Everyone in black and lighting low for urban effect. Check-in was quick, suite was spacious and well layed out. We've stayed at other W hotels with very small rooms but not here. Bedding was amazing and Bliss bath products were awesome. I ended up becoming very sick with the flu and had no cold products with me. I called their whatever/whenever line and somebody brought up Tylenol and extra tissues. We really loved the location in Westwood and was walking distance to our favorite Donut Shop, Stan's and many other restaurants. I actually got pulled over by a motorcycle cop for j-walking. Be careful driving in the area. My only gripe would be the cost for Valet parking- $28/day.

Reviews.Title: “At home at the W Los Angeles”
Reviews.Author: iamcrispydammit
Reviews.Content: I am another W Los Angeles guest surprised by the negative reviews online of this property. I had a small problem getting a light bulb replaced in the room (it took a call to the front desk, then two follow-up calls on their part to see if it had been done before it was actually accomplished), but I don't consider a burnt-out bulb to be a big problem, so fixing it right away wasn't something that irritated me. So I might agree that perhaps the staff is not up to the typical W standard for coordination, but I did not at any time find anyone unprofessional or rude. I lived in Westwood for a while and feared that the location would mean lots of noise and drunken carousing outside, but their street is away from Westwood Village and very quiet. The building seems nestled in a private jungle, and I found that its reputation for being dark was well-deserved. At night, they keep the lobby area relatively dim and use projections on the wall for decoration. I was impressed by the execution of this, since it can be glaring if not well integrated. The use of projection along with the closed-circuit tv in the elevator (not recorded or monitored, just for entertainment inside the elevator) is a nice nod to "The Industry" of the host city. The rooms are very big for hotel rooms (I had the lowest level of room), and while it is true that they do not have lots of light fixtures, during the daytime, the windows that ran along the entire side of the room (and open wide) let in plenty of light. But yes, at night, the rooms seem kind of dark. The decor is nice, but a bit reserved for a W. Again though, there is a tie-in with Los Angeles in the photos of the city at night that adorn the walls. The bathrooms are huge, and have a stand apart from the vanity for locating your own toiletries. That's a nice touch. As for the staff, I found everyone to be amazingly friendly, putting forth a lot of effort to achieve the W goal of making you feel like you're coming home when you arrive at the curb. The welcome ambassador (or whatever they call them) that greeted us upon arrival remembered my name, my interests, some amazingly obscure details from brief conversations we had and offered some amazing tips each time I passed through the doors. As for the Internet access not working, I first experienced that problem, but when they sent an engineer up to the room, he explained that the little black boxes that are inline between the ethernet from the wall and your computer often fail, so if you just use the blue ethernet cable from the wall and plug it directly into your computer, it works like a charm. I am surprised at the report from the previous reviewer that had employees talking about it being a widespread problem, since even the bellhop seemed to think that might be the problem before the engineer arrived. Perhaps they only recently discovered this workaround. Pros: Amazing welcome staff, friendly (if not well-coordinated) staff in other areas, lush surroundings, good public area design, beautiful views, that killer W bed Cons: Expensive parking rates ($24/day, I think), dark rooms (at night; maybe a pro for some), not very funky room elements for a W, although I felt the lobby made up for this

Reviews.Title: “professionally mediocre”
Reviews.Author: mjk97
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had a reservation for 7/31-8/2/2005 on a first leg of 10-day vacation of LA-Vegas-Bay area swing, but checked out early 8/1 morning, headed to Anaheim. $279/nite may not buy much in the area, but doesn't seem justified. The room was a plain, amall suite, shabby but O.K. The bathroom is big and seems to be the suite's only best feature. The rest is below average both in shape and deco. The lobby is dark and the hallway has this colorful art deco that looks shabby and old. I recon that some folks may like them, but I imagine not many. Room's view was a back of hotel's another wing in about 15 feet away. Spa construction was going on as a concrete breaker making piercing noise from 7 am'ish Sat., albeit a note of appology on it slipped through the door in the morning. ("I told you officially and now you should bear with it" ??). Broadband internet access never worked, with hotel's remote tech support person finally acknowledging that it's out of mission hotel-wide, due to be fixed on Monday. An wasted. Staff: front desk/valet parking are courteous, lone conciergie was unapproachable and busy yakking. Location:was great but I doubt I would come back to this hotel. I complained to the hotel and at the W site. The response have been always courteous and cookie-cut apologetic, but I didn't get impression from them trying to improve.

Reviews.Title: “An awesome experience!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I am surprised by all the negative reviews about the W. I stayed there from Wednesday through Friday during a job interview and it was amazing. First, I called the day before to let them know that I would arriving around 1pm, and that I wanted my room to be ready, even though that was before check-in. The receptionist was very polite and when I arrived the next day, my room was ready just as promised. My room was on the fifth floor, the farthest possible from the elevator, with a beautiful view of the pool. It was quiet and larger than many apartments I've lived in! The bliss spa products were great, and the room was clean and well-appointed. One evening, I called for a wake-up call at 5 am. When I awoke before 5 the next morning, I called to cancel it. The operator immediately asked if I'd like breakfast brought up to my room. When I ordered, I asked for it to be delivered at 5:45, and it was right on time! The staff was friendly and pleasant, and the breakfasts were delicious. I think the things that really made the stay a perfect one were: 1) call ahead if you're arriving early so your room will be ready on time 2) ask for a quiet room away from the elevators 3) be prepared to soak in the "cool vibe" of this hotel-- it's over the top, but totally entertaining!

Reviews.Title: “Not sure why the bad reviews?”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this wonderful hotel last week for 4 days. The pool was glamorous, the rooms the biggest out of any hotel I have stayed at in LA...and trust me, I have stayed at many incl. boring ones like Regent Beverly Wilshire, Park Hyatt, etc. The service was very friendly and sincere. The staff was so accommodating when I found out I was stuck one more day in LA due to bad weather. They even gave me a nice upgrade when I came back from the airport at the SAME rate because they were almost sold out but knew my dilemma. VERY nice and above the call of duty. The food was great. I felt like I was on a mini vacation rather than a biz trip. Everyone here who wrote a bad review should realize that YES, this is not a hotel like Ritz Carlton, and it is not trying to be as they are stuffy and boring, but NO, I never felt any attitude or sense of carelessness from anyone at this stylish hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful time at the W”
Reviews.Author: Tricia316
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay at the W hotel in the Westwood area of Los Angeles. I got to the hotel at 12:30pm a few hours before normal check in so the room they had for me was not ready. They asked if I minded being put in a handicap accessible room. I did not mind at all. The room was spacious and very nice. I did not have a robe and had to ask twice at the front desk for one. The restaurant in the hotel, Nine Thirty, had amazing food with reasonable prices. I enjoyed my stay.

Reviews.Title: “A little to HIP!”
Reviews.Author: JST1
Reviews.Content: A bit overboard on the LA style thing for my taste. Rooms are a good size and well furnished but the dark halls and staff dressed in balck with ear pieces are a bit much for me. Nice pool and health club and interesting breakfast but at 50 plus years of age I feel at least 25 years to old for this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “All Sizzle and No Steak”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
