Reviews.Content: The hotel looks like a remodeled dormatory but it's nicely appointed. It was the worst check-in experience ever! My wife and I waited over four hours for a handicapped room! Front desk very abbrasive and gruff. It took bell desk 15 minutes to find our bags. Pretty much a party hotel complete w/ small pool and expensive drinks. This hotel reminds me of a the ugly, insecure and bratty little brother of a much more mature and refined Vegas boutique hotel.

Reviews.Title: “No Stars at all”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The L.A W. Westwood was a convenient point to meet up with my husband for a few days of relaxation after some weeks in New Zealand when my mother had died and I'd been finding adequate care for my father whoâ€™s a double amputee and confined to a wheelchair. Within a couple of hours of my arrival, I called my father from the room at the W to let him know Iâ€™d arrived safely. He was pleased to hear this, but anxious to get back to the bridge game he was in the middle of, so the conversation lasted no more than five minutes. The hotel mistook our day of departure and presented its bill a day before we were due to leave. We were to be charged $1,800 for this one phone call to New Zealand. When I protested this exorbitant billing, security guards were called and we were given the option of coming back to L.A. to pursue the matter in Small Claims Court or leaving the hotel. We left. Unfortunately, the W Hotel in L.A. was paid its exorbitant telephone bill. As Bermudian citizens it would have cost considerably more than it was worth to return and fight the claim. A return ticket to New Zealand would have cost less than the charges the W in L.A. fraudulently extracted from us. Much like the city it serves, the Wâ€™s veneer of contrived â€œslicknessâ€� cannot disguise its ugly, grasping reality.

Reviews.Title: “wowwwww!”
Reviews.Author: herbieski
Reviews.Content: for the in crowd baby.. great reception area, pleasant employees...tv screens in elevators are nice touch..comfortable clean rooms situated in residential westwood, 10 minutes by car to rodeo drive to shop can walk to UCLA campus adjacent to UCLA, cozy town with resto and cafes the pool....can you say wowwwwwwwww..great for people watching and relaxing BABYFACE launched his new album in the bar-lounge one night that I was there

Reviews.Title: “Worst Experience In Los Angeles Ever No Sleep Possible”
Reviews.Author: shelgreb
Reviews.Content: The W Westwood can not be compared to the other W sister hotels. The mysterious white stains on the furniture were bad enough let alone the rotten dehydrated vegeatbles left on the shelves of the bar in my room. I paid $28.00 for parking to have my car parked mysteriously off site when they were hosting one of their numerous events. I was told they would need at least a 45 minute warning to retrieve my vehicle. I was kept awake for three nights straight from the screaming, whooping, and cheering coming from the bar & lobby lounge. When I complained to the manager on duty, they asked me what they could do. Their suggestion was a pair of earplugs????? Really nice. They said that they were trying to draw the fine line of being a business hotel that hosted events and that they did not realize the event would be so large. The music from the bar continued to escalate until the wee hours. I replied that maybe they should focus on some soundproofing for the hotel. When we finally did get to sleep at 3 a.m. we were woken up again by security calling my room to ask me where the party was at in the hotel. I replied it was in the lobby and how insightful they were. I checked out early the next morning. Word of warning stay clear of this hotel. the rooms, view, food, service, amenities, are all horrible.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay with some minor incedents”
Reviews.Author: TravelPort101
Reviews.Content: I gave this hotel 4 out of 5. The â€œWâ€� hotel is walking distance to Westwood and is nestled in a residential area. This is not a large hotel and is very popular for evening gatherings for the young and single on the weekend. The hotel is nicely decorated with contemporary furnishings. They are two bar areas. The out side bar is a great place to hang-out on a nice day. The room is categorized as a suite with two small rooms. The queen size bed took up most of the room, with very little walking room. Replacing the analog TVâ€™s with a plasma TV would help with the lack of space. Room was clean. I am not sure if these are regular room or for last minute reservations using Starwood points. During the night we were disturbed by doors slamming shut, they need to put hydraulic on those doors. I can say room service has never been so fast, less than 20 minutes for a full breakfast order two for 3 days. Unfortunately, on the last day they delivered an incorrect order. Now here are some issues that some feel are minor, but I think important if I were running a hotel. There was no menu for room service and no â€œdo not disturbâ€� cards for the door. There were no bath robes and house keeping did not leave any face or hand towels on our third day there, subsequent to our call they could not get it right for the rest of our stay. And there was some paper work left by a previous occupant. Calling valet to have your car available was not good. I still had to wait for them to get the car. Having the vehicle out front and ready to go would be a plus. The front desk and valet was friendly and courteous. However, the elevator security during the evening gave us the cold shoulder and the bar attendants took there time serving us, so I ordered our own drinks from the bar. The attendants in the workout room were friendly and genuine. Overall the â€œWâ€� is a nice place to stay and would like to stay in a larger room and dine at the restaurant the next time we are in the Westwood area.

Reviews.Title: “W Hotel Los Angeles (Westwood) - OK Stay but Had Problems”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We (my partner) and a friend were in Los Angeles recently for the July 4th, 2005 long weekend. Typically, we stay at Le Meridien Beverly Hills, but wanted to mix it up this time and got two suites at the W Hotel LA in Westwood. (They only have suites, no rooms, which is nice) We paid $430 a night and our friend spent over $1100 for the two nights. The hotel itself is beautifully decorated, although it was a little too dark inside. My friend suggested the dim lighting was to prevent guests from noticing the fact that the building was slightly run down, but I don't agree. There is two pools - a main pool where everyone lounges and a smaller pool off of the gym. I'd recommend coming early to guarantee a lounge chair at the main pool, otherwise you'll end up having to rent one of their cabans for $200/hr. And that is probably why they allow many of the lounge chairs to sit empty for hours just because someone had reserved it with their towel. You can also enjoy a nice lunch at the restaurant by the pool. Make sure you order a mojito. BTW, the gym is very nice and well equipped with free weights as well. The rooms themselves are spacious and the beds are very comfortable. The walls are obviously very thick as you can't hear your neighbours. Scott, at the Conceirge is also very helpful. For example, he got us last minute dinner reservation at Koi and got my friend (female) into some of the hippest night clubs in LA. It didn't hurt that she was blonde and stacked. However, there were serious problems: 1. They misplaced a pair of jeans I had laundered and didn't really seem to care about it. However, the jeans were eventually recovered (by my own efforts) but they didn't charge me for the service. 2. They initially placed us in a room with a handicap shower, i.e. a nozzle attached to a hose which you had to hold when you showering - very annoying. We had to move to a room with a 'normal' shower. 3. Before heading out for the evening, we had requested clean towels. When we returned, we discovered a stack of clean towels on the bathroom sink and a pile of damp towels still sitting in the tub. We called downstairs and informed them that we were going to put the used towels in the hall way and asked them to send someone up to pick them up. At that time, the night manager (who had only been there for 2 months) threaten to throw us out of the hotel if we did that. I have never have been threaten to be kicked out of a hotel ever. When I went downstairs to confront the night manager, he was agressive, hostile and rude. There was no apology or attempts to resolve the situation in an appropriate manner. Furthermore, we had requested a bliss kit, i.e. a package of the mini-shampoo, lotion, etc... you get in your room. What we got was a brown paper bag with several of the little bottles sitting in our sink. Overall the experience was fine. However, that experience with the night manager soured our entire stay. At this time, we're undecided if we'd return to another W Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “what a nightmarish hotel -- mess doesn't come close”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: the price is 400.00 per night and here's what happened to me: I arrived on 6/14/05 at 5 pm for business meetings in LA. I'm to leave tomorrow at noon and I'm writing this from my immediate experience in the hopes others will spend their money anywhere but here. Here's a list of what has gone on since my arrival last nite at 5 pm and its now 11 pm the next eve -- this is in just over 24 hours: 1) on arrival the shower was broken -- had to call engineering. they got it working best they could for me to shower; then came back later when i went out; didn't fix it properly -- had to return the next day 2) no robe in the closet on arrival; had to call housekeeping 3) during the night -- the toilet broke and sound of water running non-stop 4) during the night -- the bedroom phone suddenly began ringing for no reason -- i had to unplug it left the living room phone on... 5) I had ordered a wake up call for 8 am -- woke at 7-40 am and called down i didn't need the 8 am call. no problem they said. I went back to sleep and 20 mins later at 8 am they called to wake me. 6) I ordered breakfast -- cappucino with sweet n low. they didn't bring the sweet n low or sugar. 7) lunch -- i had to rush for a meeting so i ordered in my room. hamburger med rare to rare -- came medium well -- in fact toasted. 8) I asked the waiter to remove the lunch at 2-30 when i left for my meeting; he assured me he would come back. when i returned at 5 pm it was sitting there -- leftover hamburger was now rancid meat that made the room smell terrible. someone had been kind enough to put fresh fruit in the room next to the tray with the now rancid meat!! 9) dinner with friend downstairs -- the waiter asked if we wanted dessert. we said no, we'd sit a bit. he immediately brought us the check which we thought was rude -- we intended to order another glass of wine. they had several empty tables so clearly he didn't need ours. 10) i returned to the room intending to relax and watch a dvd. I had to call the concierge because there was no list of dvd's in the room. She told me to look for a W book with list inside. There wasn't a W book. she promised to send one up. It never arrived. I had to call her TWO MORE TIMES to get the list of dvd's. list arrived: I ordered. 11) someone brings up film -- its not a dvd -- its video. I send it back. I don't have a vcr. And the guy tells me they actually don't have but FOUR DVD'S IN THE HOTEL but every room has a dvd player. they have videos but no vcr's in the room. I call the concierge -- she says they'll install a vcr. 12) engineer installs the vcr -- tells me there's no remote -- no surprise. 13) i call concierge for a video. she asks what happened to the last one -- i say i sent it back because no vcr. she sends it again. 14) toilet starts running again - 2nd night in row. engineer has to fix it again. 15) in bathroom there's one tiny bar of "bliss" soap. they don't allow you any extra so you can't have one in bathtub and one in sink. you have to carry your pittance of soap from the bathtub to the sink and back again. and use it over and over...at 400.00 per nite 16) the walls are filthy and stained; no painting done in how long. 17) manager says that my experience is an exception. think so? read the other reviews which i just saw now...looks like this hotel should be closing down.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely Pleased!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: awesome hotel. terrific, friendly service and going above and beyond! beautiful, clean, fresh rooms and the most comfortable bed and crisp sheets. food was delicious and service in the restaurant (near the pool) friendly and prompt.

Reviews.Title: “over rated”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed here only because it was within walking distance to our business meetings. Though we used points for the room, I would rather not use my points on this place if distance wasn't such a high factor. If you must stay here other than for reason of trying to look oh so cool for staying at "W" then make sure your room is not by the elevators and away from the frat houses with their loud partying. Read the "Urine" review for their take on being near the bar/club of the hotel. Probably true. The Newark "W" wasn't too bad though.

Reviews.Title: “Urine on the pillow experience!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We arrived Friday afternoon for a 2 night stay. Took 30 minutes to check us in with NO LINE. Seems the four people behind the counter were training a new girl and didn't care how long guests would have to wait. We got over it and moved up to our room only to find they stuck us on the lowest floor right off the elevators. I figured since I brought my 2 dogs, this would be a good thing for walking them. Boy was I wrong. The loudness starts at 8pm and continues till 3am due to the Whisky Blue club downstairs. As I turned off the lights and cuddled up on my W provided goose down pillow, I noticed a strong stench of urine coming from the pillow. Upon closer inspection, I found it was indeed a dried urine stain clear as day on the pillowcase. Now this leads me to believe if they don't change the pillowcases, just imagine the germ content of their duvey covers!!! Disgusted,I quickly disposed of the pillow and used another one and tried to get to sleep. Around 11:30 pm, some male guests in the hallway apparantly became violent. I heard shouting, cursing and the sound of objects banging against the hallway walls. I was frightened actually and didn't open my door till I was sure the guys left. When I peeked to see what had happened I saw a light fixture had been torn from the ceiling and broken glass was everywhere. The mess stayed there till the next afternoon, even after I called about it. Now I know what it must feel like to sleep in the Ghetto. The room also faced over the entrance/exit of the hotel and club, so lucky us got to hear the drunken fighting from outside the club at last call 2:30am. When we visited the restaurant 930 the following night, Saturday,we were immediately accosted by four hostesses in short skirts, who despite our 8pm reservation, informed us we had to wait at least another 1/2 hour. We got a drink at Whisky Blue and when our table was ready, the hostess informed us we could no bring our drinks into the restaurant because they were 2 different companies. Inconvenient at best. The banquet seating was cramped and the service so so. For the money you spend at the W Westwood, it is a sad sorry time away from home.

Reviews.Title: “Cool, hip...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We spent 8 nights at the W because my wife had a conference at UCLA to attend. Since we had a newborn my wife was breast feeding, we wanted to stay close to campus so I walk our son over to her for feedings. The W is really the only Hotel within walking distance. That said, we didnâ€™t really know what to expect. We travel a lot and always stay at high-end hotels but had never been to a W before. The Hotel is very cool! Everything seems to be very stylized and well thought out. I spent a lot of time by the pool (the big pool, there are two) and felt like a movie star â€“ the pool is a place to see and be seen. The lobby is very nice and we found the location to be great. The shops and restaurants of Brentwood are all within a few blocks walking distance. We were a little surprised that for a hotel this size, there is not a fine dining restaurant. They do have an outdoor restaurant by the pool thatâ€™s pretty casual that we ate every day and enjoyed (with a newborn, we really werenâ€™t going to do a whole lot of fine dining, anywayâ€¦) The best part, by far, was the room. We had a standard room and it was huge! It felt like we were staying in a suite with a sitting room, separate bedroom, 2 TVâ€™s, and huge bath. Since we were there for over a week, we really dug in and made it our home. We could put our son down in one room and have a whole another room for us. The staff was great. Housekeeping did a great job. Based on our experience, we will definitely stay in W Hotels again!

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms, iffy service”
Reviews.Author: razbox
Reviews.Content: Great rooms - I had 2 lounges(!) + a large bedroom, good location, noisy bar (make sure you get a room above floor 5 and pref on the pool view side). Staff were great on the phone, but for some reason quite snooty when talking to guests face to face. Nowhere nearby to park overnight, so you will most likely have to use the expensive valet parking.

Reviews.Title: “What a disappointment!”
Reviews.Author: Writer46
Reviews.Content: Just returned from an extended stay (9 nights) at this hotel and was really ''saddened' by the experience. Here is this beautiful property where a fortune has been spent on a face lift for the former Westwood Marquis. The suites are all done in W style--which I think lacks personality and could use some splashes of color--color which is strangely absent from this hotel in its entirety. I question whether the furniture was completely new due to the rather staggering number of stains on the upholstery in both rooms I had. I had one of the larger suites--three rooms--a living room, bedroom and office--which face the rear of the hotel and was much more quiet and serene than anything facing the street or overlooking the pool area....which was the fate of several of my co-workers. This is a scene hotel--the lobby bar is packed with pretty young things and there are a steady stream of hipper than thou young people who party hearty. You'd do well to avoid any room on a lower floor in front or overlooking the pool. The noise is such that one of my co-workers had to be moved in the middle of the night. But the problem here isn't the rooms with their excellent beds-- it's the service or almost complete lack of it. I came home at 8:00 to find two maids in the room giving it the first housekeeping service of the day! There is no turndown service at all which might solve the ice shortage... I waited up to 45 minutes for ice from room service The only competent service is in the Parking Garage...everyone else gives attitude and looks pretty and that's about it. One bellman promised to look after two things for me and never appeared again. The other problem here is that the the menu is extremely limited and unchanging from brunch to lunch to dinner. What is served is certainly passable but no one would want to eat there 9 days straight which was our fate. The main restaurant, which we were assured would be open, was not. The outdoor restaurant is the only option and in the flooding rains of last week, was forced indoors to take up a position in some conference rooms on the second floor. There tables were set for 8 and 12 so you were forced to sit with strangers--not my idea of a good time. The only option to this unattractive arrangement was room service and the delays were horrific -- 45 minutes for abowl oif cereal and juice and this with a 20% service charge attached to it. Amazingly, one young bartender told me that they had staffed up in preparation for the opening of the restaurant. Why these waiters weren't pressed into service to cope with the room service is beyond me. This really is a sad state of affairs at a hotel that could be so much better. I think service in this Hotel seems to suffer from the fact that there is only one professional waiter (Moses) in the bunch--the rest are all incredibly cute boys and girls who clearly have no intention of staying longer than it takes to pay for their head shots. I do feel badly about writing this. But it's just a dirty rotten shame that this place hasn't got its act together. If I were W management, I wouldn't allow this place to denigrate my brand the way it does. I'll wait here to read whether it ever lives up to its potential.

Reviews.Title: “Disgraceful”
Reviews.Author: Rob1233
Reviews.Content: Some of the staff were very kind and helpful, but this hotel was a complete waste of money. The rooms are adequate, but the walls are paper thin, the traffic noise from outside is terrible (no double glazing) and it was especially disappointing to hear the staff cleaning the next-door room at midnight with the stereo on full-tilt! The pool staff are hilariously bad, way too cool to actually do their job and find somewhere for you to sit - prefer to just grunt at people and tell people where they can't sit! Reading other reviews, it seems to be a regular occurrence to close the swimming pool and the bar down for private events, leaving nowhere for the guests to go. Indeed when we stayed there a couple of weeks ago, the whole hotel was taken over by a film crew and we were even banished from the lobby!! Would never go back. the W hotel in San Diego is decent, though..

Reviews.Title: “Wish I stayed longer”
Reviews.Author: JCSide
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night only after flying to LAX, before driving to Las Vegas the next day. I wish we had more time here. I found the atmosphere very relaxed, and the environment very pleasant. The hotel was in a fairly quiet neighbourhood. Lobby, restaurant and bar are very nicely presented. We had drinks in the bar (great but pricey), and also breakfast in the restaurant, which couldn't be faulted. Pity we didn't have time to use the pool area, but that looked stunning. Our junior suite room was clean and well decorated, bathroom was large and nicely appointed. Staff were efficient but not stuck up. They all seemed to be models and made us feel a bit unglamourous though ! I would come here again but need a while to save up the cash !

Reviews.Title: “Expensive with attitude!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Plain and simple...overpriced!! Restaurant/Bar is being renovated which is by far the best reason to stay here. It normally has great atmosphere and good drinks, albeit expensive. However on this stay, hotel staff kept their renovation quiet. Staff seem to have a chip on their shoulder. Pool area is nice place to have a drink. Hotel rooms are full of amenities, but room had a 'curious' smell, and mini fridge did not work. Overall, would recommend to visit the bar for a cocktail, but stay somewhere cheaper.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stay here about four or five times a year when we visit our daughter at UCLA. The location simply cannot be beat -- you can walk to UCLA and to great restaurants in Westwood. We always stay in a suite on an upper floor with wonderful views of downtown LA. So far, our rooms have been very quiet and comfortable. Yes, the atmosphere is a bit Hollywood, but that's part of the fun. This is Westwood/Bel Air, after all. Rent the movie "Win a Date with Tad Hamilton" -- some of the movie was filmed at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Something special”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: On a recent business trip I was upgraded to an incredible 2-bed, 2-bath suite with an office and a huge lounge area. As I was interviewing people the following day this was invaluable. The staff were especially friendly and very efficient. The location of the hotel in a quiet neighbourhood is perfect for getting away from the bustle of the city, but it's close enough to many of the fun parts of L.A. to make it a good base.

Reviews.Title: “Alternative scene”
Reviews.Author: jv282
Reviews.Content: If you want a very "cool," "LA" place to stay, the W is great. But I found it cold and empty and sterile. Drinks are overpriced ($12 martinis). Rooms are small. You may see a rap star or two, but that's about it in terms of excitement. Far from Sunset bars. Westwood is ok for a night, but gets old so if you don't have a car don't stay at the W. If you are visiting kids at UCLA and don't mind overpaying, then the W is the nicest walking distance hotel. But the Hilgard House across the street probably will give you everything you need for a third of the price.

Reviews.Title: “W - stands for WHAT THE ..........????????”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We are a family of 4 and stayed at the W Los Angeles in a two bedroom suite. The furniture must have come from an IKEA sale. What little furniture there was, was either torn or did not work. It is desperate for a renovation. The wall are made of paper, not great if you don't like to hear the next door apartment at 5:00am turning on their tv. There is no soundproofing from the street and you can hear any car passing by. The service at the poolside restarvice was pathetic to say the least. Ontop of this, every single chair around the pool was booked for a private event, so screw the paying guests. We were booked in for 4 nights but barely made it through one. Even after they gave us the night free we still felt ripped off.

HotelInfo.Name: W Los Angeles - Westwood
HotelInfo.Address: 930 Hilgard Avenue, Los Angeles, CA 90024
